column4: hey all. thunderbird doesn't allow me to save passwords. any ideas?
what is the error message?
there is no errror message. it just won't show the checkbox at the beginning of the session
see the second paragraph here http://kb.mozillazine.org/Password_not_remembered_(Thunderbird)
i have tried that, but it still doesn't show the checkbox
did the parameter change back to false when you started thunderbird?
nope. it remains on true
i'm editing it from the edit config under edit->preferences
can you paste your prefs.js file to pastebin?
it's the one in etc/thunderbird/profile right? it's here http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/327553/
this file should be located in ~/.mozilla-thunderbird<Profile name>/ or ~/.thunderbird/<Profile name>/
<Profile name> is your unique profile name
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/327555/
you can try to insert into this file user_pref("signon.rememberSignons", true);
and restart thunderbird
didn't work. but i tried to rename the .mozilla-thunderbird folder to make it create a new one. i set up an account and it shows the checkbox now
cool.. so the problem definetely was in configs
yep. but now i'm not sure i know how to import in the new one all the old files, to have mail, addons and settings as in the old one, without importing the problem
you can try to restore back old .mozilla-thunderbird and place prefs.js file from a new one.. this will show if the problem is tied to this file
oh, yes. one sec
also save the old prefs.js
sure
it works. now i can maybe try a long work of copy pasting the pref one by one and see what messes it up
yes, this should work :)
